data.chText: （通常因道义上的原因而）谴责，指责
data.enText: to express very strong disapproval of sb/sth, usually for moral reasons

data.chText: 政府发表声明谴责这些凶杀事件。
data.enText: The government issued a statement condemning the killings.

data.chText: 这家报纸的主编被指责为不够正直。
data.enText: The editor of the newspaper was condemned as lacking integrity.

data.chText: 宣判；判处（某人某种刑罚）
data.enText: to say what sb's punishment will be

data.chText: 他因凶杀罪被判处死刑后被绞死。
data.enText: He was condemned to death for murder and later hanged.

data.chText: 她因杀害亲夫被处以绞刑。

data.hoverText: 动词+名词短语+带to的不定式

data.enText: She was condemned to hang for killing her husband.

data.chText: 迫使…接受困境（或不愉快的状况）
data.enText: to force sb to accept a difficult or unpleasant situation

data.chText: 他们不得不过着艰难的生活。
data.enText: They were condemned to a life of hardship.

data.chText: 他无可奈何地只得在这个足球赛季剩下的时间里做替补队员。
data.enText: He was condemned to spend the rest of the football season on the bench.
to say officially that sth is not safe enough to be used

data.chText: 一座已宣告不能居住的危楼
这种肉被宣告不宜食用。
data.enText: The meat was condemned as unfit to eat.
to show or suggest that sb is guilty of sth

data.chText: 她自己说的话显示她有罪责。
data.enText: She is condemned out of her own mouth (= her own words show that she is guilty) .

simple_means.memory_skill: con 共同 + demn 伤害；惩罚 → 共同惩罚 → 谴责

means: (通常因道义上的原因而)指责
迫使…接受困境(或不愉快的状况)

ex.enText: If it all goes awry, don't blame me.

ex.chText: 组织者把到场人数少归咎于天气。
ex.enText: Organizers blame the weather for the low turnout.

synonyms.bx: 普通用词，表示把过错或坏事归咎于某人或某事。

ex.chText: 他因早上迟到而受到责备。
ex.enText: He was admonished for being late this morning.
He admonished me for drinking too much.

synonyms.bx: 通常指对某人所做的错事当面给予批评、警告等。

ex.chText: 她可能会借机声讨一番那些心胸狭隘的保守党成员。
ex.enText: She might take this opportunity to berate the narrow-minded conservative members.

synonyms.bx: 指因某人的过错而气愤地训斥、责备某人。

ex.chText: 他们都谴责他的卑鄙行为。
ex.enText: They censured him for his mean behaviour.

ex.chText: 在真相未明前不要谴责她。
ex.enText: Don't censure her before the truth is evident.

synonyms.bx: 侧重指公开、不留情面地批评或指责。

ex.chText: 那位政治家谴责任何形式的暴力行为。
ex.enText: That politician condemns violence of any sort.

synonyms.bx: 尤指从道义上对某人或某事予以谴责。

ex.enText: The father rebuked the child for his disobedience.

ex.chText: 他因玩忽职守受到训斥。
ex.enText: He was rebuked for his neglect of duty.

synonyms.bx: 指对某人的过错给予尖锐的斥责，含刻薄或愤怒之意。

ex.enText: He reproached her for her forgetfulness.

ex.chText: 他们每天愚昧而粗鲁地指责政府。
ex.enText: They reproach the government every day with folly and impertinence.

synonyms.bx: 指失望、不满或愤恨地指责某人，但这种指责有时可能失于公正。

tr: declare or judge unfit for use or habitation
example: The building was condemned by the inspector
We condemn the racism in South Africa

tr: pronounce a sentence on (somebody) in a court of law
example: He was condemned to ten years in prison
the county condemned the land to build a highway

tr: compel or force into a particular state or activity
example: His devotion to his sick wife condemned him to a lonely existence

value.def: If you condemn something, you say that it is very bad and unacceptable.

example.ex: Political leaders united yesterday to condemn the latest wave of violence...
example.tran: 政界领袖昨日联合起来对最近激增的暴力事件予以谴责。

example.ex: Graham was right to condemn his players for lack of ability, attitude and application.
example.tran: 格雷厄姆指责队员们技艺不佳、态度不端正而且不够努力，他说得没错。

example.ex: ...a document that condemns sexism as a moral and social evil.
example.tran: 把性别歧视视作道德和社会弊端予以谴责的文件

value.def: If someone is condemned to a punishment, they are given this punishment.

example.ex: He was condemned to life imprisonment.

example.tran: 被判死刑的囚犯们提出的上诉

value.def: If circumstances condemn you to an unpleasant situation, they make it certain that you will suffer in that way.

example.ex: Their lack of qualifications condemned them to a lifetime of boring, usually poorly-paid work...
example.tran: 没有学历使他们一辈子都得从事枯燥乏味而且通常报酬很低的工作。

example.ex: He felt condemned to being alone...
example.tran: 他觉得自己注定要孤独终老。

example.ex: Mark was condemned to do most of the work.
example.tran: 马克被迫承担大部分工作。

value.def: If authorities condemn a building, they officially decide that it is not safe and must be pulled down or repaired.

example.ex: State officials said the court's ruling clears the way for proceedings to condemn buildings in the area.
example.tran: 州政府官员称法庭判决为宣布该地区楼房为危房的行动扫清了道路。

rootsaffixes.indicate: = to harm, to punish 伤害；惩罚
rootsaffixes.title: demn, damn

partsOfSpeech.dec: con 共同 + demn 伤害；惩罚 → 共同惩罚 → 谴责
in 不 + demn 伤害；惩罚 + ify 使… → 使不受损害 → 赔偿
in 不 + demn 伤害；惩罚 + ity 具备某种性质，状况 → 赔偿（物）
